lexUnit.name: shrug.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: raise (one's shoulders) slightly and momentarily to express doubt, ignorance, or indifference.

sentence.text: The Chairmaster shrugged his shoulders and shook his head at the same time , finally dislodging the reluctant wig .
She shrugged her shoulders , tossed her plaits , tilted her chin , looked cool .
Stephen shrugged his shoulders .
Jimmy looked enquiringly at him and Pete just shrugged his shoulders .
He shrugged his shoulders .
McIllvanney shrugged acceptance of my refusal , then held up a hand to stop me leaving .
She turned a furious damp face on Rossendale who could only shrug mute agreement .
` I do n't think so , " shrugs Alex .
But Louis was on deck and Gomez shrugged his apologies : ` I must get the trucks loaded .
` Well , I ca n't think where she is then , " shrugged Enid .
He shrugged one shoulder .
He guessed that a reaction was expected and shrugged .
Nicola Schreider shrugged small , beautifully proportioned shoulders , and glanced at her watch .
The doctor glanced at Jim and shrugged helplessly .
Piper managed to catch Bernice 's eye , but the archaeologist only shrugged helplessly .
They shrugged at each other .
She shrugged at him , and he looked away .
Sam shrugged at me .
They shrugged at his noises and Mallachy 's , and winced gallically at their jokes , some of them translated for their benefit .
Ellen shrugged at his rudeness .
She shrugged at the American woman -- it had happened in Viet Nam .
Patrick shrugged in embarrassment .
I shrugged in frustration .
The slender shoulders shrugged in irritation .
John shrugged in resignation and disgust .
Nanette shrugged again : a sudden , nervous jerk .
The boy shrugged again , then went into the hall .
She swung round to face me , shrugged gracefully and the dress fell to the ground as if a statue were being unveiled .
The woman shrugged slightly .
He shrugged then turned his attention to a new customer at the other end of the counter .
There 's only so much you can do with a Super B , " he shrugged .
